result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron R. Griffin

records.addlTxt: Atty Christian received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Christian enters not guilty pleas.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters not guilty plea(s).  Atty Christian will contact Br. 1 for further scheduling.  DE confirms address.

11:01 AM Defendant Cameron R. Griffin in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Cameron R. Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2
DE to be booked on or before October 20, 2022.

1:04 PM Defendant Cameron R. Griffin in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Cameron R. Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Christian explains missed court appearance due to transportation and family issues.  Time limits NOT waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $200 cash bond.  Atty Christian recommends a $500 signature bond.  $100.00 CASH bond set.  DE to be booked on or before October 20, 2022.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return on warrant on September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:15 PM Defendant Cameron R. Griffin not in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Cameron R. Griffin.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Christian advises DE was scheduled in Br. 1 today and DE did not appear and a warrant was issued for DE's arrest in that case.  Court notes a Summons was mailed to DE and has retained counsel.  State requests a warrant.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
for Discovery and Demand for Production of Documents
